Shortbow.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Shortsword.name: 短剑
Shortsword.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

Kackle.name: Kackle
Kackle.description:
Kackle

Laughing Lantern Bearer

Habitat: Any

 Treasure: Implements

Those who were particularly sadistic in life and died consumed by wicked mirth linger as Kackles—ghostly figures that drift above the ground, always flitting just out of sight. Adorned in tattered cloaks and concealing hoods or hats, their hollow laughter echoes through dark places, fading in and out to confuse and terrify their victims. Kackles always carry lanterns lit with ghostly flames, the color of which changes to reflect a kackle’s current cruelty of choice.

Secret. Kackles are bound to their lanterns, and smashing their lights can snuff out the spirits’ existence.

Lantern Flame.name: Lantern Flame
Lantern Flame.description:
Melee or Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft. Hit: Varies by lantern color (kackle's choice):

  • Blue. 7 ([[/r 1d6 + 4]]) Cold damage, and the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

  • Green. 20 ([[/r 3d10 + 4]]) Necrotic damage, and the target’s Speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

  • Purple. 10 ([[/r 1d12 + 4]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

  • Red. 15 ([[/r 2d10 + 4]]) Fire damage, and the target starts burning, taking 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) Fire damage instead of the regular burning damage.

Flickering Teleport.name: Flickering Teleport
Flickering Teleport.description:
The kackle teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The kackle can then change its lantern color, and it can create the following—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 5-foot Emanation originating from the kackle’s destination space.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage of the same type as the current Lantern Flame color.

Success: Half damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The kackle can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Lantern Vulnerability.name: Lantern Vulnerability
Lantern Vulnerability.description: The kackle’s lantern has AC 15 and Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage. Any damage the lantern takes deals half that amount of Force damage to the kackle.

The Grinning Sinner.name: The Grinning Sinner
The Grinning Sinner.description:
The Grinning Sinner

Dealer of Jinxes

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Once the dashing pirate captain Briggsy Kratch, the crocodile-folk now known as the Grinning Sinner made a bargain for power with a spirit known as Snake Eye Jack. The sinner grew discontent with the power he was gifted and tricked Jack into a coffin before sealing him inside. Now the Grinning Sinner siphons his trapped patron’s cursed power and makes bargains of his own to snare the souls of the desperate and foolish.

Secret. The Grinning Sinner holds his prowess and reputation as a fearsome and successful pirate captain above all; causing him to doubt his renown can turn his hexed magic against him.

The Grinning Sinner’s Lair

The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand.

The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Fate’s Wheel. Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck. Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract 1d4 from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Bane.name: Bane
Bane.description:
你选择施法距离内至多三个你可见的生物，迫使其分别进行一次魅力豁免。在法术终止前，豁免失败于此次魅力豁免的目标进行的每次攻击检定与豁免检定都必须承受 1d4 的减值。

升环施法：你使用的法术位每比一环高一环，就能多选择一个生物作为目标。

Bane.name: 灾祸
Bane.description: 在法术结束前，该目标进行的攻击检定或豁免检定都必须从检定结果中减去 1d4。

Bestow Curse.name: Bestow Curse
Bestow Curse.description:
你触碰一名生物。该生物必须进行一次感知豁免并成功通过，否则将在法术持续时间内被诅咒。施展法术时，你从以下诅咒选项选择其一：

  • 选择一个属性值。受诅咒影响时，目标进行该属性的豁免检定和属性检定时具有劣势。
  • 受诅咒影响时，目标对你进行的攻击检定具有劣势。
  • 受诅咒影响时，目标必须在其每回合开始时进行一次感知豁免，豁免失败则浪费掉该回合的动作。
  • 受诅咒影响时，你的攻击和法术对目标额外造成 1d8 的暗蚀伤害。

法术移除诅咒可终止此法术的效应。DM 也可以让你选择其他诅咒，但它们不该比上表更强大。诅咒效应最终由 DM 裁定。

升环施法： 使用四环或更高法术位施展该法术时，法术的持续时间变为：专注，至多 10 分钟。使用五环或更高法术位时，变为 8 小时。使用七环或更高法术位时，变为 24 小时。使用九环法术位时，法术将持续到被解除。使用五环或更高法术位施展此法术时无需在其持续时间内维持专注。

Major Image.name: 高等幻影
Major Image.description:
你创造一个影像，其形象来自一个大小不超过边长 20 尺立方体的物件，生物或其他的可视现象。影像出现在施法距离内你能看见的一处位置并在法术持续时间内维持存在。它看起来完全是真实的，并且还具有相应的声音、气味和温度。你不能创造出足以造成伤害的酷热或严寒，也不能创造出音量大到足以造成雷鸣伤害或者震聋生物的声响，同样不能创造出会使生物恶心的气味（近似穴蜥人的恶臭那种）。

在该幻象施法距离内时，你可以用你的动作将影像移动到施法距离内的另一个位置。影像改变位置时，你可以改变影像的外表来使它移动得更自然。例如，如果你创造了一个生物的影像并移动它，则你可以改变影像，使它看起来就像是在走路。或者你也可以让影像在不同的时间发出不同的声音，甚至可以让它参与一场对话。

由于影像无法被碰到，任何与该影像进行的物理互动都会暴露其幻象的本质。一个生物用其动作调查影像时，它可以进行一次对抗你的法术豁免 DC 的智力（调查）检定，以判定是否看穿幻象。辨出幻象的生物可以看破该影像，而影像的其他感官效应在该生物看来会变得微弱而模糊。

升环施法： 使用六环或更高法术位施展该法术时，法术会持续至解除且不需要你保持专注。

Remove Curse.name: 移除诅咒
Remove Curse.description: 你触碰一名生物或一个物件，使影响其的所有诅咒终止。如果该物件是一件诅咒魔法物品，则其上的诅咒将维持，不过该法术可以打破诅咒物品与其所有者之间的同调，使其所有者可以将其卸下或丢弃。

Animate Dead.name: 活化死尸
Animate Dead.description:
该法术创造一个不死生物仆从。在施法距离内指定一具中型或小型类人生物遗骨或遗体，并以该法术将污秽的虚假生命力量注入其中，将之唤起为一个不死生物。如果你选择的是遗骨，则目标变为骷髅；选择的是遗体则变为僵尸。该生物的具体游戏资料由 DM 掌控。

在你的任一回合内，你可以使用一个附赠动作并以精神命令操纵 60 尺内任何你用此法术唤起的生物（如果你操纵多个生物，则你的命令可以同时传达给它们全部或是其中的某几个，不过只能使用同一种命令）。你决定被操纵生物下回合的动作和移动。或者，你也可以选择下达宽泛的命令（比如守护某个房间或走廊）。没有接受到你命令的生物则只会对敌对生物作出自卫行为。一旦被下达命令，该生物会持续执行命令直到任务完成。

这些受操纵生物只会在 24 小时内服从你的命令。如果你在当前的 24 小时时间段终止前再施展该法术，则你对这些生物的操纵时间再延长 24 小时。法术的此种用法只能延长你对至多四个你使用此法术所创造生物的控制时间，而不会创造新的生物。

升环施法：使用四环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比三环高一环，就会多唤起两只不死生物，或是多延长对两只不死生物的控制。你无法用同一具骸骨或遗体唤起多个不死生物。

materials.value: 一滴血，一块肉，以及一点骨灰

Creation.name: 造物术
Creation.description:
你从堕影冥界取来一些暗影物质，并在施法距离内创造一个非活体的物件。你可以创造一个植物质（类似纺织品、绳索、木质等）的物件。也可以创造一个矿物质（类似石质、水晶、金属等）的物件。创造出来的物件大小必需在 5 立方尺内，且其形态与材质你必需曾经见过。

法术的持续时间由所创造物件的材质决定。如果所创造物件由多种材质组合而成，则其存在时间取其中最短者。

  • 植物质 - 1 日
  • 石质或水晶 - 12 小时
  • 贵金属 - 1 小时
  • 宝石 - 10 分钟
  • 精金或秘银 - 1 分钟

施展其他法术时，如果以这些创造物作为其材料成分将会使该法术施法失败。

升环施法： 使用六环或更高法术位施展该法术时，你使用的法术位每比五环高一环，创造物尺寸的立方边长就加大 5 尺。

materials.value: 所创造物品的一小部分

Darkness.name: 黑暗术
Darkness.description:
你在施法距离内指定一点，并在法术持续时间内使魔法的黑暗充斥该点半径 15 尺的球状区域。该黑暗会绕过拐角扩散，连拥有黑暗视觉的生物也无法看穿这这种黑暗，而非魔法的光照也无法在区域内提供照明。

如果你选择的是你所持有的物品上的一点，或是一个没有被穿戴或携带的物体，光芒就从该物体发出，并随之移动。用不透明的物体（例如碗或头盔）完全遮住该物体将阻挡光芒的照射。

若该法术区域与 2 环或更低法术创造的光亮区域重叠，则创造该光亮的法术将被解除。

materials.value: 蝙蝠毛发，以及一滴沥青或一小块煤

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The sinner casts one of the following spells using his Curse Bottle (and no other material components) and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.pO4zGe5LmFIYqJiL], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.nslx2nT3p4lNkmdp], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oyE5nVppa5mde5gT], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.lnaGnxMzpYnbw1uU], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.S7VbUetIfVT7B6Eq]

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The sinner makes two attacks, using [[/item Hex Grasp]] or [[/item Blunderbuss]] in any combination. He can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.95K2aUhAGV9qXjnf].

Hex Grasp.name: Hex Grasp
Hex Grasp.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature, it is cursed until the start of the sinner’s next turn, or until the sinner curses it in this way again. While cursed, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and on ability checks that rely on an ability of the sinner’s choice.

Blunderbuss.name: 火铳
Blunderbuss.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is pushed up to 10 feet straight away.

Curse Blast.name: Curse Blast
Curse Blast.description:
The sinner unleashes one of the following curses from his blunderbuss:

  • Jack’s Anguish. A magenta wave fires out with a deep, wailing moan. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only. A &Reference[Frightened apply=false] creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • Shadowy Friends. A wave of shadow coughs forth and wraps around foes in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw or become &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] until the end of the sinner’s next turn. If a &Reference[Paralyzed apply=false] target takes damage, the condition ends early.

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: The sinner can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The sinner regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Barbed Curse.name: Barbed Curse
Barbed Curse.description: The sinner targets one creature cursed by him or affected by his Bane spell within 30 feet of himself. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 6 ([[/r 1d12]]) force damage.

Jinxed Ground.name: Jinxed Ground
Jinxed Ground.description: Cursed magenta symbols flash on the ground within 20 feet of the sinner. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Grinning Grasp.name: Grinning Grasp
Grinning Grasp.description: The sinner teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within 30 feet. He makes one [[/item Hex Grasp]] attack before or after teleporting and can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: The Grinning Sinner’s lair is the derelict riverboat casino, the Dead Man’s Hand. The region containing the Grinning Sinner’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Grinning Sinner dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Fate’s Wheel.name: Fate’s Wheel
Fate’s Wheel.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, if the number rolled on a die to restore hit points is even, increase the number rolled by 1. If the number rolled is odd, reduce it by 1.

Run of Bad Luck.name: Run of Bad Luck
Run of Bad Luck.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, a creature that rolls a 1 on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from its next roll that isn’t a damage roll.

Coffin Rider.name: Coffin Rider
Coffin Rider.description: The sinner has a magic coffin that has immunity to all damage. While standing on the coffin, the sinner rides it on a ghostly wave of swamp water with a speed of 60 feet and can move over liquids as if they were solid.

Curse Bottle.name: Curse Bottle
Curse Bottle.description: The sinner has a bottle that holds cursed magic. The bottle has AC 15, HP 25, and immunity to all damage except force. If the bottle is destroyed, the sinner can magically create a new one when he finishes a long rest.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the sinner fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Overweening Pride.name: Overweening Pride
Overweening Pride.description: As a bonus action, a creature can insult the sinner’s skill and renown as a pirate captain. The sinner must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 psychic damage and have disadvantage on attack rolls against any target other than the creature.

TXYz5iHztVsWNjrM.name: Doctor Belkin
TXYz5iHztVsWNjrM.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Implements

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bllEWfm9xfEKynhv]{Mind Blank} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aU62xVUBYkAQWIHv]{Nondetection} spell, has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon's Blindsight).

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Critical Hit: If the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description:
The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is infested with larval parasitic worms. The target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) Psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes Poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this Psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description:
Trigger: The surgeon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Response: The parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 具有某项技能熟练（由DM选择），且在进行使用该技能的属性检定时具有优势。

Isolde, the Grim.name: Isolde, the Grim
Isolde, the Grim.description:

Ethereal Sight.name: 以太视界
Ethereal Sight.description: 该幽魂在物质位面时可以看到以太位面60尺内的情况，反之亦然。

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description:
该幽魂可以穿过其他生物和物件，如同它们是困难地形。

如果它在物件内结束其回合，它将受到5 (1d10) 力场伤害。

Withering Touch.name: 凋零之触
Withering Touch.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+5 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (4d6 + 3) necrotic damage.

Etherealness.name: 以太化
Etherealness.description: 幽魂从物质位面进入以太位面，或反之亦然。当它在边界太空中时，在物质位面上是可见的，反之亦然，但它无法影响也无法被另一个位面上的任何事物影响。

Horrifying Visage.name: 恐惧面容
Horrifying Visage.description:
距离该幽魂60尺内, 能看见它的每个非不死生物生物必须进行一次DC 13 感知豁免, 豁免失败则恐慌1分钟。若豁免结果比DC低5或更多, 目标还会衰老1d4 x 10年。

一个恐慌的目标可以在每个自己的回合结束时重复该豁免, 豁免成功则自身结束恐慌状态。若一个目标的豁免成功或此效应对其结束, 该目标在接下来的24小时内对此幽魂的骇人外貌免疫。衰老效应可以通过高等复原术法术逆转, 但仅限于其发生后的24小时内。

Possession.name: 附身
Possession.description:
该幽魂5尺范围内一个它能看见的类人生物必须进行一次DC 13魅力豁免，失败则被幽魂附身；随后幽魂消失，目标陷入失能状态并失去对身体的控制权。幽魂此时掌控着躯体但不会剥夺目标的感知。

除驱散不死生物类效果外，幽魂无法被任何攻击、法术或其他效应选定为目标，且保留其阵营、智力、感知、魅力及对魅惑和恐慌的免疫。其余情况使用被附身目标的资料卡，但无法获取目标的知识、职业特性或熟练项。附身持续至躯体生命值降至0、幽魂以附赠动作主动终止、或被驱散或类似反制善恶法术的效应驱逐。附身结束时，幽魂在躯体5尺内未占据空间重新显现。目标在豁免成功后或附身结束后的24小时内对该幽魂的附身免疫。

UKt4WVtAy5UBHZiv.name: Hospital Horror
UKt4WVtAy5UBHZiv.description:
Hospital Horror

Mutated Experiment

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Hospital horrors were once people, but now they are repulsive mockeries created through surgical and magical alteration. They have no memory of their past lives, existing only within a chemically induced rage. Often, they are conditioned by the use of specific command phrases that allow them to be controlled.

Secret. Hospital horrors have spent much of their existence being prodded with needles, so being pierced frays what few wits they retain.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The horror makes two [[/item Graft Blade]] attacks.

Graft Blade.name: Graft Blade
Graft Blade.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Stim Burst.name: Stim Burst
Stim Burst.description: The horror takes the Dash action and can jump up to 30 feet by spending 10 feet of movement.

Aversion To Needles.name: Aversion To Needles
Aversion To Needles.description: If the horror takes Piercing damage, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

Pack Tactics.name: 集群战术
Pack Tactics.description: The horror has Advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the horror’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally doesn’t have the &reference[incapacitated apply=false] condition.

Club.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+2 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 (1d4) bludgeoning damage.

Amorphous.name: 无定形
Amorphous.description: 该阴影可以穿过窄至1英寸宽的空间而无需挤身。

Shadow Stealth.name: 幽影隐匿
Shadow Stealth.description: 在微光光照或黑暗环境下，该暗影可以用附赠动作执行躲藏动作。

Sunlight Weakness.name: 日光弱点
Sunlight Weakness.description: 处于阳光照射下时，该暗影在攻击检定、属性检定和豁免上具有劣势。

Strength Drain.name: 力量吸取
Strength Drain.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) necrotic damage.

The target's Strength score is reduced by 1d4. The target dies if this reduces its Strength to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse 1d4 hours later.

Alpengrendel.name: Alpengrendel
Alpengrendel.description:
Alpengrendel

Brute Born of Mountain Ice

Habitat: Arctic, Mountain

Treasure: Any (except Relics)

Alpengrendel are hulking creatures covered in bluish white fur, with great tusks and horns. They were born of the ice and darkness of their mountaintop homes, shaped by the unseen hands of a deity of cold stone and gloam. The bitter cold of the mountain peaks infuses both their touch and their breath.

Alpengrendel draw upon the timelessness of the mountains, healing from otherwise lethal wounds in the blink of an eye. They fear only the power of lightning, which can slay them, and the power of the gods, whom they bitterly resent.

Secret. Their disdain for deities runs so deep that alpengrendel are enraged and unnerved by the trappings of faith.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The alpengrendel makes one Claws attack and one Tusks attack.

Claws.name: 爪击
Claws.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] Damage.

Tusks.name: Tusks
Tusks.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Frost Breath.name: 冷冻吐息
Frost Breath.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: 21 (6d6) Cold damage. Until the start of the alpengrendel’s next turn, the target’s Speed is halved, and it has Disadvantage on attack rolls.

Success: Half damage only.

Aversion To Faith.name: Aversion To Faith
Aversion To Faith.description: The alpengrendel has Disadvantage on attack rolls while in a consecrated area or on attack rolls against a creature holding or wearing a Holy Symbol.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The alpengrendel regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If the alpengrendel takes Acid or Lightning damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The alpengrendel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

The Dusk Mother.name: The Dusk Mother
The Dusk Mother.description:
The Dusk Mother

Shade of Motherly Anguish

Habitat: Any

The keening wail of a mother is unmistakable and haunting, and the legends that tell of the Dusk Mother barely scratch the surface of her terrifying existence. She carries a pair of oversized shears and a great bell she tolls to accompany her wailing. Her eternal torment stems from her children, who met their fate due to the Dusk Mother’s negligence—or perhaps her wrath. Now she cries in shame for that loss as she searches for her children, or for souls to claim and fashion into dolls in a futile attempt to fill the void in her doomed soul.

Secret. The Dusk Mother’s only true weakness or fear is the remnants of her children—some trinket or toy they played with in life or, more chillingly, their spirits, which also wander the world, but never in the same place as their mother’s shade.

The Dusk Mother’s Lair

The Dusk Mother’s lair is a home or other place in a settlement where tragedy struck, most often those involving children or families broken by loss. If encountered in her lair, the Dusk Mother has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP).

The region containing the Dusk Mother’s lair is changed by her presence, creating the following effects:

Enduring Dirge. Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures with an Intelligence score higher than 4 who can speak at least one language absently sing nursery rhymes or funeral songs without intending to.

Thoughts of Loss. Whenever a living creature within 1 mile of the lair finishes a short rest, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or it gains no benefit from the rest.

If the Dusk Mother dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The mother makes three [[/item Shears]] attacks.

Shears.name: Shears
Shears.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature and is hit with two or more Shears attacks in the same turn, it gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false].

Mournful Tolling.name: Mournful Tolling
Mournful Tolling.description: The mother focuses her wail into her bell. Each creature within 30 feet of the mother must make a DC 22 Wisdom saving throw. A Construct, an Undead, or a creature that has ever been raised from the dead is unaffected. On a failed save, a target takes 77 ([[/r 14d10]]) psychic damage that ignores damage resistance, and the target becomes &Reference[Stunned apply=false] until the end of the mother’s next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only.

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: The mother can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The mother regains spent legendary actions at the start of her turn.

Drift.name: Drift
Drift.description: The mother moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When she enters a creature’s space during this move, that creature takes 16 ([[/r 3d10]]) cold damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Snip.name: Snip
Snip.description: The mother makes one [[/item Shears]] attack. On a hit, the target takes an extra 4 ([[/r 1d8]]) necrotic damage.

Endless Keening.name: Endless Keening
Endless Keening.description: Each creature within 30 feet of the mother that can hear her must make a DC 22 Constitution saving throw. A Construct, an Undead, or a creature that has ever been raised from the dead is unaffected. On a failed save, a target takes 28 ([[/r 8d6]]) necrotic damage that ignores damage resistance, if any. A target that fails by 5 or more is reduced to 0 hit points. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: The Dusk Mother’s lair is a home or other place in a settlement where tragedy struck, most often those involving children or families broken by loss. If encountered in her lair, the Dusk Mother has a challenge rating of 25 (75,000 XP). The region containing the Dusk Mother’s lair is changed by her presence, creating the following effects: If the Dusk Mother dies or moves her lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Enduring Dirge.name: Enduring Dirge
Enduring Dirge.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, creatures with an Intelligence score higher than 4 who can speak at least one language absently sing nursery rhymes or funeral songs without intending to.

Thoughts of Loss.name: Thoughts of Loss
Thoughts of Loss.description: Whenever a living creature within 1 mile of the lair finishes a short rest, it must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw or it gains no benefit from the rest.

Soul Doll.name: Soul Doll
Soul Doll.description: The mother targets the corpse of a creature she killed within the last minute. The target’s soul is drawn out and transforms into a ceramic doll of the creature. The doll is a Tiny object with AC 15, HP equal to half the creature’s maximum hit points, vulnerability to thunder damage, and immunity to poison damage. The soul can dimly see and hear its surroundings, and creatures with telepathy can communicate with the soul. If the doll is destroyed, the soul arises from the doll as a Shadow under the mother’s control. The creature can’t be returned to life unless its soul is freed from the doll by a Wish spell, or by destroying the shadow it spawned.

Death’s Shroud.name: Death’s Shroud
Death’s Shroud.description: The mother is always &Reference[Invisible apply=false]. Blindsight, truesight, and other effects that allow a creature to see &Reference[Invisible apply=false] creatures don’t reveal the mother. A creature that has been reduced to 0 hit points at least once in its life can see her normally.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The mother can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. She takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if she ends her turn inside an object.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the mother fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The mother has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Steadfast Matron.name: Steadfast Matron
Steadfast Matron.description: Undead creatures of the mother’s choice within 60 feet of her (excluding herself) have advantage on saving throws. She can’t use this trait if she is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Undeniable Guilt.name: Undeniable Guilt
Undeniable Guilt.description: At the start of her turn, if the mother can see a possession once owned by her living children, or if she can see or hear the spirits of her children, she becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of her next turn, and she must move as far from the object or spirits as possible.

UzPMKkoHuofBeXO2.name: Chimera
UzPMKkoHuofBeXO2.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) piercing damage.

Claws.name: 爪击
Claws.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

Fire Breath.name: 火焰吐息
Fire Breath.description: 龙首向15尺锥形区域喷吐火焰。该区域内的每个生物必须进行一次DC15 敏捷豁免，豁免失败则受到31 (7d8) 火焰伤害，豁免成功则伤害减半。

Multiattack.name: Multiattack
Multiattack.description: The chimera makes three attacks: one with its bite, one with its horns, and one with its claws. When its fire breath is available, it can use the breath in place of its bite or horns.

Horns.name: 角击
Horns.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+7 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d12 + 4) bludgeoning damage.

Nurse Sarah Godlee.name: Nurse Sarah Godlee
Nurse Sarah Godlee.description:
Mutant Nurse

Caregiver Twisted by Mutation

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Arcana

Mutant nurses resemble the Humanoids they once were, though an alien mutation writhes within their bodies. They serve as caretakers of healing institutions, though they are fully beholden to whoever, or whatever, altered them to their current state. The nurses all wear a white porcelain mask made in the likeness of their original features, which grounds them to their sense of self and prevents them from losing their will fully to the aberrant influence that changed them.

Secret. Mutant nurses go berserk if their masks are destroyed or taken from them, or they become unresponsive if there are no other creatures nearby.

Anchoring Mask.name: Anchoring Mask
Anchoring Mask.description: The nurse has a porcelain mask (AC 15; HP 15; Immunity to Poison and Psychic damage). If the nurse starts its turn and isn’t wearing its mask, it must move as far as possible to retrieve its mask if possible, or to reach the closest creature it can see or hear, and it must attack that creature. If it can’t see or hear any other creatures, it either stands still and does nothing, or it destroys any objects in its vicinity (50 percent chance of either).

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The nurse makes two [[/item Stab]] attacks. If it hits a creature with a Stab attack, it can use Inject if available.

Stab.name: Stab
Stab.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Inject.name: Inject
Inject.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 13, a creature the nurse hit with a Stab attack this turn.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition for 1 hour.

Failure by 5 or More: The &reference[poisoned apply=false] target also has the &reference[unconscious apply=false] condition until it takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to shake it awake.

Success: Half damage only.

Mutation.name: Mutation
Mutation.description:
The nurse has one of the following mutation action options:

  • Cerebral Graft. Part of a psionic creature’s brain is grafted to the nurse’s own.

    Intelligence Saving Throw: DC 13, one creature within 30 feet.

    Failure: 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Psychic damage, and the target has the &reference[stunned apply=false]condition until the end of its next turn.

    Success: Half damage only.

  • Tentacle Lash. A tentacle writhes beneath the nurse’s skin or clothes.

    Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 13, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

    Failure: 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

    Success: Half damage only.

Catalyst.name: Catalyst
Catalyst.description: The nurse injects itself with a stimulant. Until the start of the nurse’s next turn, its Speed is doubled, it can make one extra Stab attack when it takes the Multiattack action, and it gains a +2 bonus to AC.

Necrolisk.name: Necrolisk
Necrolisk.description:
Necrolisk

Subterranean Spirit-Devouring Drake

Habitat: Planar (Shadow), Underground

Treasure: Individual, Relics

Necrolisks are subterranean dragons that feed on the essence of spirits. Tunneling through the ground in search of corpses, especially those buried in graveyards and crypts, they defile the graves and feed on the bodies in an effort to stir up restless spirits, which are then snared in the necrolisks’ ephemeral saliva and devoured. Creatures of flesh and blood that disturb the dragons might also find themselves as a less preferred, but passable, meal.

Secret. Necrolisks are severely allergic to a concoction of lavender, nightshade, and lilies, which causes them to vomit uncontrollably—a boon to anyone swallowed by the monsters.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The necrolisk makes one [[/item Bite]] attack and one [[/item Claws]] attack.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, it has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Claws.name: 爪击
Claws.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Ephemeral Spit.name: Ephemeral Spit
Ephemeral Spit.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Swallow.name: 吞咽
Swallow.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 18, one Large or smaller creature &reference[grappled apply=false] by the necrolisk (the necrolisk can only have one creature swallowed at a time).

Failure: The necrolisk swallows the target, which is no longer Grappled. While swallowed, the creature has the &reference[blinded apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false] conditions, has Total Cover against attacks and other effects outside the necrolisk, and takes [[/damage average]]damage at the start of each of the necrolisk’s turns.

If the necrolisk takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the necrolisk must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls in a space within 10 feet of the necrolisk and has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

If the necrolisk dies, a swallowed creature is no longer Restrained and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting &reference[prone apply=false].

Entrapping Saliva.name: Entrapping Saliva
Entrapping Saliva.description: The necrolisk ignores Immunity to the &reference[grappled apply=false] and &reference[restrained apply=false] conditions of a creature with the Incorporeal Movement trait. Creatures swallowed by the necrolisk can’t pass through it using Incorporeal Movement or through the Ethereal Plane, and creatures can’t teleport out of its stomach.

Herb Allergy.name: Herb Allergy
Herb Allergy.description: If the necrolisk eats a specific concoction of herbs worth 25 GP (such as if a swallowed creature pours them into its stomach as a Utilize action), at the end of the turn, the necrolisk regurgitates anything in its stomach as if it failed the saving throw described in its Swallow Bonus Action.

Spider Climb.name: 蛛行
Spider Climb.description: The necrolisk can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Tunneler.name: 掘道者
Tunneler.description: The necrolisk can burrow through solid rock at half its Burrow Speed and leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

Crocodile.name: 鳄鱼
Crocodile.description: Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description:
Melee Weapon Attack:+4 to hit,, 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d10 + 2) piercing damage.

The target is grappled (escape DC 12). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the crocodile can't bite another target.

Solomon Roderick.name: Solomon Roderick
Solomon Roderick.description:
Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Token artwork by Forgotten Adventures.

Chain Shirt.name: 链甲衫
Chain Shirt.description: 该护甲由互相锁接的金属环组成，通常着装于布衣或皮衣的夹层之间。这种护甲为着装者的上半身提供了适中的保护，且锁环间相互碰撞的声音也可以被外层衣服减弱。

Shield.name: Shield
Shield.description: 盾牌通常由木材或金属制成，可以单手进行持用。持用一面盾牌可以令你的护甲等级 +2。不过同一时间里你只能从一面盾牌中受益。

Spear.name: 矛
Spear.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage or 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

Theodora Mayville.name: Theodora Mayville
Theodora Mayville.description:
Pigeon Hag

Vermin Hag of Deception and Control

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Fey), Urban

Pigeon hags are vain witches who place themselves above every other being. They seek to reinforce that belief by controlling and undermining the knowledge and relationships of others. Pigeon hags often insinuate themselves into a mortal settlement and walk among the people, usually in a position to hear and spread gossip that they can twist and manipulate to their own ends.

Secret. The vanity of a pigeon hag is so overwhelming that polishing its ego can leave it flustered and briefly unable to act.

Command (as 2nd-level spell).name: Command (as 2nd-level spell)
Command (as 2nd-level spell).description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Hold Person.name: 定身类人
Hold Person.description:
选择射程内一个你能看见的类人生物。目标必须进行一次感知豁免，豁免失败则在该法术的持续时间内被&Reference[麻痹]。在每个自己的回合结束时，目标可以再进行一次感知豁免。豁免成功则法术对该目标终止。

升阶效应。施展该法术时，若你使用的法术位为3环或更高，则法术每比2环高一环，你就能多指定一个类人生物作为目标。指定目标时，这些类人生物彼此之间的距离不得超过30尺。

Hold Person.name: 人类定身术
Hold Person.description: 你在法术期间麻痹。你在施法者的每一回合结束时可以再进行一次感知豁免，豁免成功则终止自身上该法术的效应。

Minor Illusion.name: 次级幻象
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束。你也可以用一个动作解除幻象，或者再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

如果你创造一个物件的影像（比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等），则该物件大小不得大于一个边长5尺的立方体。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物件所穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

生物用其动作调查该声响或影像时，必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免DC的智力（调查）检定，检定成功则判断出眼前即是幻象。幻象在看穿它的生物面前会显得模糊不清。

Stinking Cloud.name: Stinking Cloud
Stinking Cloud.description:
你在射程内的一点创造出一个半径20尺的黄色恶心气体球状区域。云雾会绕过拐角扩散，其区域为重度遮蔽。云雾在持续时间内悬浮在空中。

每个在回合开始时完全处于云雾内的生物必须进行一次对抗毒素的体质豁免。豁免失败则生物该回合的动作将用于呕吐和眩晕。不需要呼吸或对毒素免疫的生物自动通过该豁免。

和风（至少10英里/小时）会在4轮后驱散云雾。强风（至少20英里/小时）会在1轮后将其驱散。

materials.value: 一个臭鸡蛋或几片臭菘叶

Feeblemind.name: 弱智术
Feeblemind.description:
指定施法距离内一个你能看见的生物，并尝试摧毁其理智与人格。目标受 4d6 点心灵伤害且须进行一次智力豁免。

豁免失败时，该生物的智力和魅力变为 1。受术生物将不能施法，也不能启动魔法物品，甚至不能听懂语言或以智慧方式沟通。但该生物仍可以辨识、跟随伙伴，甚至保护他们。

受术生物每过 30 日即可在当日结束时重新进行一次豁免，豁免成功则该法术效应终止。

除此之外，高等复原术，医疗术或者祈愿术也可直接终止该法术的效应。

materials.value: 一把粘土，水晶，玻璃或矿物球

Feeblemind.name: 弱智术feeblemind
Feeblemind.description: 该生物的{智力 Intelligence}和{魅力 Charisma}变为 1。该生物不能{施展 cast}{法术 Spells}、启动{魔法 Magic}物品、理解语言或以任何智能方式沟通。然而，该生物可以{鉴定术identify identify}其{交友术friends friends}、跟随他们，甚至保护他们。

Dominate Person.name: 支配类人
Dominate Person.description:
你尝试迷惑一个在射程内你能看见的类人生物。它必须进行一次感知豁免，若失败则在该法术的持续时间内被你&Reference[魅惑]。若你或对你友好的生物正在与它战斗，则它在该豁免中具有优势。

当目标被魅惑时，只要你与它处于同一位面，你便与它存在心灵感应连结。你可以用此连结向该生物下达命令(无需动作)，而它会尽力服从。你可以指定一个简单且概括的行动方针，例如“攻击那个生物”、“跑到那边”或“取来那个物件”。如果该生物完成了命令且没有从你处收到进一步的指示，它便会尽其所能地自卫和求生。

你可以使用你的动作来完全且精确地控制目标。直到你的下一回合结束前，该生物仅采取你选择的动作，并且不会做任何你不允许它做的事。在此期间，你还可以令该生物使用反应，但这需要你也使用你自己的反应。

每当目标受到伤害时，它需针对该法术进行一次新的感知豁免。若豁免成功，则该法术终止。

升环施法效应。当你使用6环法术位施展该法术时，持续时间为专注，至多10分钟。当你使用7环法术位时，持续时间为专注，至多1小时。当你使用8环或更高法术位时，持续时间为专注，至多8小时。

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: 目标被魅惑了，而且必须尽其所能遵从任何来自施法者的指令。

Scrying.name: 探知术
Scrying.description:
你能看见和听见一个和你处于同一存在位面上的生物。目标生物必须进行一次感知豁免；该豁免的调整值与你对目标的了解程度有关，也与你和目标之间的物理联系程度有关。如果目标知道你在施展该法术，而它又愿意被你观察，则它可以自愿放弃该豁免。

了解程度 豁免调整值
二手信息（你曾经听说过目标） +5
直接信息（你曾经见过目标） +0
熟悉（你对目标很了解） -5
你持有目标的… 豁免调整值
肖像或其他图像 -2
衣物或其他物品 -4
身体部位如头发或指甲 -10

如果对方豁免成功，则目标不受该法术影响，并且在 24 小时内你不能尝试探知同一个目标。

如果对方豁免失败，则你在目标身边 10 尺内创造出一个隐形的传感器。通过传感器，你可以身临其境地看见和听见周围的环境。传感器会跟随目标移动，并在法术持续时间内始终保持在目标 10 尺之内。在能够看破隐形的生物眼中，你的探传感器是一个拳头大小的光球。

除生物之外，你也可以选择一个你以前见过的地点作为该法术的目标。这时，传感器会出现在目标地点且不会移动。

materials.value: 一个至少价值 1000GP 的法器，例如水晶球、银镜、圣水盆

Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).name: Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary)
Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

Agonizing Cackle.description: The hag laughs maniacally, and each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 45 ([[/r 10d8]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of the hag’s next turn. Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Disarming Vanity.name: Disarming Vanity
Disarming Vanity.description: As an action, a creature that flatters the hag forces it to succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the end of the hag’s next turn.

Harrying Wings.name: Harrying Wings
Harrying Wings.description: When the hag rolls initiative, it is surrounded by fey spirits in the form of angry pigeons. The hag’s enemies within 10 feet of it have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. This trait doesn’t function if the hag is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Coven Magic.name: 集会魔法

The hag must finish a long rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

VqpHUD4kyEsW9s2J.name: Festerhulk
VqpHUD4kyEsW9s2J.description:
Festerhulk

Fungal Undead Giant

Habitat: Forest, Swamp, Underground

Festerhulks are dead giants whose corpses are infested with fungus engorged by the magic of decay. This fungus has consumed and replaced much of the giant’s flesh and now animates the corpse. The heads of these giants are often completely overtaken by repulsive mushrooms and other fungal growths. The spores given off by their infestation can spread to victims killed by festerhulks, giving rise to further Undead.

Secret. Festerhulks shrink from sunlight, which harms the fungus that animates them.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The festerhulk makes two [[/item Fetid Slam]] attacks and uses Slime Mold if available.

Fetid Slam.name: Fetid Slam
Fetid Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Slime Mold.name: Slime Mold
Slime Mold.description: The festerhulk disgorges a mass of ravenous slime mold into an unoccupied space within 20 feet. This mass uses the Black Pudding stat block except it is a Plant, and its size is Medium. The mass acts on the festerhulk’s initiative. It, and any masses it Split into, dries up and dies in 1 hour.

Fungal Step.name: Fungal Step
Fungal Step.description: The festerhulk ignores difficult terrain caused by plants or fungi.

Spore Cloud.name: 孢子云雾
Spore Cloud.description: At the end of each of the festerhulk’s turns, each creature within 5 feet of the festerhulk takes 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) necrotic damage and is &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the end of its next turn. A Giant or Humanoid killed by this damage rises as a new creature 24 hours later: Festerhulk (if a Giant), Zombie (if a Humanoid).

Sunlight Hypersensitivity.name: 日照超敏
Sunlight Hypersensitivity.description: The festerhulk takes 10 radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Boneflayer.name: Boneflayer
Boneflayer.description:
Boneflayer

Voracious Carrion Eater

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Mountain

Boneflayers are cruel, vulture-like creatures that originated from a broken fey pact. The creatures aren’t content to wait for something to die and instead make their own carrion to gorge upon—they delight in snatching prey in their talons, carrying it into the air, and dropping it to its death. Boneflayers earn their name by using their sizeable, filth-riddled beaks to cleave flesh from bone and hoard the meat until it ages enough for them to enjoy.

Cults sometimes use boneflayer killing grounds as a source of bones to burn in ritual bonfires, occasionally making pacts with the creatures to pay or trade for the creature’s castoffs. Villages that fear boneflayer attacks ward them off with thundering drums or gongs whenever they circle overhead.

Secret. A lingering result of the fey bargain that created them, boneflayers are disoriented and diminished by loud, thunderous noises.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The boneflayer makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Talons]] attack.

Beak.name: 喙啄
Beak.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and if the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

Talons.name: 禽爪
Talons.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 14) from both talons. While &Reference[Grappled apply=false], the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Swoop.name: 鹏落
Swoop.description: If the boneflayer has a creature &Reference[Grappled apply=false], the boneflayer flies up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks and drops that creature.

Flyby.name: 飞掠
Flyby.description: The boneflayer doesn’t provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Thunderous Ward.name: Thunderous Ward
Thunderous Ward.description: When the boneflayer hears a drum or gong, or takes thunder damage, it has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of its next turn.

The Harlequin.name: The Harlequin
The Harlequin.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]. This can’t raise the target’s &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level above 5, and all levels of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] gained from this action end when the target finishes a short or long rest, or if it receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

Gibbering Mouther.name: 呓语之口
Gibbering Mouther.description: 指示物插图由Forgotten Adventures提供。

Aberrant Ground.name: 异变丛生
Aberrant Ground.description: 源自 [[lookup @name]] 的 [[lookup @target.template.size activity=zVznqPXgYjETqpQz]] 尺光环区域内的地面视为 &Reference[Difficult Terrain]。

Gibbering.name: 呓语
Gibbering.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] babbles incoherently while it doesn't have the Incapacitated condition.

Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]], any [[lookup @target.affects.type activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] that starts its turn within [[lookup @target.template.size activity=PyGOI84k0PPYrru8]] feet of the [[lookup @name lowercase]] while it is babbling.

Failure: The target rolls [[/r 1d8]] to determine what it does during the current turn:

1–4. The target does nothing.

5–6. The target takes no action or Bonus Action and uses all its movement to move in a random direction.

7–8. The target makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can't make such an attack.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: [[/attack extended]]。[[/damage average extended]]。若目标生物体型不超过中型，则其陷入 &Reference[Prone apply=false] 状态。若目标因此伤害生命值降至 0，目标死亡。然后其肉体被 [[lookup @name]] 吸收，仅留下装备。

Prone.name: 倒地
Prone.description: 若你的生物体型不超过中型，则你陷入 &Reference[Prone apply=false] 状态。

Blinding Spittle.name: 致盲唾液
Blinding Spittle.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]]-foot-radius Sphere centered on a point within [[lookup @range.value activity=JfU8KFZkAJxWtrhk]] feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Blinded apply=false] condition until the end of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Blinded.name: 目盲
Blinded.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Blinded apply=false] 状态，直至呓语之口的下一回合结束。

Wou9MoWctZhNBzi0.name: Ferryman
Wou9MoWctZhNBzi0.description:
Ferryman

Cursed Undead Boatman

Habitat: Coastal, Swamp

Ferrymen are Undead created through the use of curses and jinxcraft and are doomed to ply the waters where they were raised. They pole through the bayous and rivers, and even across land on a wave of swamp water, in coffin boats. They can focus the malice of their curse through the light of their lantern poles, jinxing enemies or those who try to force a ride without payment.

Secret. Paying a ferryman 3 copper coins lifts any curse the creature placed on the payer, and it entitles one to a single unnerving but safe ride in the ferryman’s coffin boat.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The ferryman makes two [[/item Lantern Pole]] attacks and uses Hexed Lantern if available.

Lantern Pole.name: Lantern Pole
Lantern Pole.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Hexed Lantern.name: Hexed Lantern
Hexed Lantern.description: The ferryman unleashes a burst of light from its lantern in a 30-foot cone. Each creature of the ferryman’s choice in that area must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw or be cursed for 1 minute. While cursed in this way, the target must subtract [[/r 1d4]] from ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws.

Coffin Boat.name: Coffin Boat
Coffin Boat.description: The ferryman rides an open coffin on a swell of swamp water, allowing it to travel with a speed of 40 feet over any surface, including liquids, ignoring difficult terrain. The coffin can hold two other Medium creatures. Two Small creatures or four Tiny creatures count as one Medium creature. While riding the coffin, the ferryman has immunity to being knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false], and the coffin moves with the ferryman unless the ferryman becomes &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false]. The coffin has AC 15; HP 25; immunity to necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. If the coffin is destroyed, the ferryman can magically create a new one using a 10-minute ritual.

Payment.name: Payment
Payment.description: The ferryman must peacefully offer a ride in its boat to a creature that takes an action to offer it 3 cp. If that creature is cursed by the ferryman, the curse ends. If the boat is full, the ferryman must return to offer the creature a ride once its current passengers leave the boat. If the creature or its allies damage the ferryman or force it to make a saving throw, this effect ends and the creature can’t use that ferryman’s Payment trait again.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The ferryman regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns if it has at least 1 hit point.

Wildpyre.name: Wildpyre
Wildpyre.description:
Wildpyre

Spectral Blazing Beast

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

When animals perish in flames, their escaping spirits can cling to the fire that took their lives and arise as wildpyres. These Undead resemble the kind of animal they were in life, though made of ghostly flames. They lash out at anything in their vicinity, fanning the flames that consumed them.

Secret. Water can extinguish the undying flames of wildpyres, despite their ephemeral existence.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The wildpyre makes two [[/item Blazing Rend]] attacks and uses Flame Bind if available.

Blazing Rend.name: Blazing Rend
Blazing Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target begins burning. If the target is a creature no larger than the wildpyre, it has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Flame Bind.name: Flame Bind
Flame Bind.description:
Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 15, one creature the wildpyre can see within 60 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition. At the end of each of the target's turns, it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. During the target's turn, it can choose to end the Restrained condition by taking [[/damage average]] damage.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The wildpyre can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Quenching Water.name: Quenching Water
Quenching Water.description: Any water affects the wildpyre as if it were Holy Water.

Wormhost Surgeon.name: Wormhost Surgeon
Wormhost Surgeon.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Treasure: Implements

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description:
Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Critical Hit: If the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description:
The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is infested with larval parasitic worms. The target takes 7 ([[/r 2d6]]) Psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes Poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If the target is reduced to 0 Hit Points by this Psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description:
Trigger: The surgeon is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Response: The parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid—

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 14, each creature in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 Hit Points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes Poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 Hit Points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.bllEWfm9xfEKynhv]{Mind Blank} or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.aU62xVUBYkAQWIHv]{Nondetection} spell, has the &reference[invisible apply=false] condition toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon's Blindsight).

Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only).description:
[[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]]. If the target is a Humanoid, it is subjected to the following effect.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s curse for 24 hours.

Shape-Shift.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] shape-shifts into a Large wolf-humanoid hybrid form or a Medium wolf, or it returns to its true humanoid form, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

Life Drain.description:
Life Drain.
