A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.actors24.Actor.mmZombie00000000]{Zombie} under the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at a time.

Xcn9r6lnzzE4O85V.name: Pigeon Hag
Xcn9r6lnzzE4O85V.description:
Pigeon Hag

Vermin Hag of Deception and Control

Habitat: Mountain, Planar (Fey), Urban

Pigeon hags are vain witches who place themselves above every other being. They seek to reinforce that belief by controlling and undermining the knowledge and relationships of others. Pigeon hags often insinuate themselves into a mortal settlement and walk among the people, usually in a position to hear and spread gossip that they can twist and manipulate to their own ends.

Secret. The vanity of a pigeon hag is so overwhelming that polishing its ego can leave it flustered and briefly unable to act.

Command (as 2nd-level spell).name: Command (as 2nd-level spell)
Command (as 2nd-level spell).description:
You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or follow the command on its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the DM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

Hold Person.name: 定身类人
Hold Person.description:
选择射程内一个你能看见的类人生物。目标必须进行一次感知豁免，豁免失败则在该法术的持续时间内被&Reference[麻痹]。在每个自己的回合结束时，目标可以再进行一次感知豁免。豁免成功则法术对该目标终止。

升阶效应。施展该法术时，若你使用的法术位为3环或更高，则法术每比2环高一环，你就能多指定一个类人生物作为目标。指定目标时，这些类人生物彼此之间的距离不得超过30尺。

Hold Person.name: 人类定身术
Hold Person.description: 你在法术期间麻痹。你在施法者的每一回合结束时可以再进行一次感知豁免，豁免成功则终止自身上该法术的效应。

Minor Illusion.name: 次级幻象
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束。你也可以用一个动作解除幻象，或者再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

如果你创造一个物件的影像（比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等），则该物件大小不得大于一个边长5尺的立方体。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物件所穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

生物用其动作调查该声响或影像时，必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免DC的智力（调查）检定，检定成功则判断出眼前即是幻象。幻象在看穿它的生物面前会显得模糊不清。

Stinking Cloud.name: Stinking Cloud
Stinking Cloud.description:
你在射程内的一点创造出一个半径20尺的黄色恶心气体球状区域。云雾会绕过拐角扩散，其区域为重度遮蔽。云雾在持续时间内悬浮在空中。

每个在回合开始时完全处于云雾内的生物必须进行一次对抗毒素的体质豁免。豁免失败则生物该回合的动作将用于呕吐和眩晕。不需要呼吸或对毒素免疫的生物自动通过该豁免。

和风（至少10英里/小时）会在4轮后驱散云雾。强风（至少20英里/小时）会在1轮后将其驱散。

materials.value: 一个臭鸡蛋或几片臭菘叶

Feeblemind.name: 弱智术
Feeblemind.description:
指定施法距离内一个你能看见的生物，并尝试摧毁其理智与人格。目标受 4d6 点心灵伤害且须进行一次智力豁免。

豁免失败时，该生物的智力和魅力变为 1。受术生物将不能施法，也不能启动魔法物品，甚至不能听懂语言或以智慧方式沟通。但该生物仍可以辨识、跟随伙伴，甚至保护他们。

受术生物每过 30 日即可在当日结束时重新进行一次豁免，豁免成功则该法术效应终止。

除此之外，高等复原术，医疗术或者祈愿术也可直接终止该法术的效应。

materials.value: 一把粘土，水晶，玻璃或矿物球

Feeblemind.name: 弱智术feeblemind
Feeblemind.description: 该生物的{智力 Intelligence}和{魅力 Charisma}变为 1。该生物不能{施展 cast}{法术 Spells}、启动{魔法 Magic}物品、理解语言或以任何智能方式沟通。然而，该生物可以{鉴定术identify identify}其{交友术friends friends}、跟随他们，甚至保护他们。

Dominate Person.name: 支配类人
Dominate Person.description:
你尝试迷惑一个在射程内你能看见的类人生物。它必须进行一次感知豁免，若失败则在该法术的持续时间内被你&Reference[魅惑]。若你或对你友好的生物正在与它战斗，则它在该豁免中具有优势。

当目标被魅惑时，只要你与它处于同一位面，你便与它存在心灵感应连结。你可以用此连结向该生物下达命令(无需动作)，而它会尽力服从。你可以指定一个简单且概括的行动方针，例如“攻击那个生物”、“跑到那边”或“取来那个物件”。如果该生物完成了命令且没有从你处收到进一步的指示，它便会尽其所能地自卫和求生。

你可以使用你的动作来完全且精确地控制目标。直到你的下一回合结束前，该生物仅采取你选择的动作，并且不会做任何你不允许它做的事。在此期间，你还可以令该生物使用反应，但这需要你也使用你自己的反应。

每当目标受到伤害时，它需针对该法术进行一次新的感知豁免。若豁免成功，则该法术终止。

升环施法效应。当你使用6环法术位施展该法术时，持续时间为专注，至多10分钟。当你使用7环法术位时，持续时间为专注，至多1小时。当你使用8环或更高法术位时，持续时间为专注，至多8小时。

Dominate Person.name: Dominate Person
Dominate Person.description: 目标被魅惑了，而且必须尽其所能遵从任何来自施法者的指令。

Scrying.name: 探知术
Scrying.description:
你能看见和听见一个和你处于同一存在位面上的生物。目标生物必须进行一次感知豁免；该豁免的调整值与你对目标的了解程度有关，也与你和目标之间的物理联系程度有关。如果目标知道你在施展该法术，而它又愿意被你观察，则它可以自愿放弃该豁免。

了解程度 豁免调整值
二手信息（你曾经听说过目标） +5
直接信息（你曾经见过目标） +0
熟悉（你对目标很了解） -5
你持有目标的… 豁免调整值
肖像或其他图像 -2
衣物或其他物品 -4
身体部位如头发或指甲 -10

如果对方豁免成功，则目标不受该法术影响，并且在 24 小时内你不能尝试探知同一个目标。

如果对方豁免失败，则你在目标身边 10 尺内创造出一个隐形的传感器。通过传感器，你可以身临其境地看见和听见周围的环境。传感器会跟随目标移动，并在法术持续时间内始终保持在目标 10 尺之内。在能够看破隐形的生物眼中，你的探传感器是一个拳头大小的光球。

除生物之外，你也可以选择一个你以前见过的地点作为该法术的目标。这时，传感器会出现在目标地点且不会移动。

materials.value: 一个至少价值 1000GP 的法器，例如水晶球、银镜、圣水盆

Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).name: Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary)
Word of Recall (lair as sanctuary).description:
You and up to five willing creatures within 5 feet of you instantly teleport to a previously designated sanctuary. You and any creatures that teleport with you appear in the nearest unoccupied space to the spot you designated when you prepared your sanctuary (see below). If you cast this spell without first preparing a sanctuary, the spell has no effect.

You must designate a sanctuary by casting this spell within a location, such as a temple, dedicated to or strongly linked to your deity. If you attempt to cast the spell in this manner in an area that isn't dedicated to your deity, the spell has no effect.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.arzCrMRgcNiQuh43], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3Lo9boi7P2ro6QV4], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.oIzA2MEHwxhtQneU], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.TwlD4PLcltv7Xh7j]

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.hYCrN82dMJFuJODB], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.91Sw6vOIaO7U8DvM], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.fVbCxFRaORalHB20], @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.76C0FdcxlU8F9Rl2]

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The hag makes three [[/item Claw]] attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of [[/item Spellcasting]] (at will spells only).

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Agonizing Cackle.name: Agonizing Cackle
Agonizing Cackle.description: The hag laughs maniacally, and each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a DC 19 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 45 ([[/r 10d8]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the start of the hag’s next turn. On a successful save, a target takes half as much damage only.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or it returns to its true form. Other than its size, its game statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Disarming Vanity.name: Disarming Vanity
Disarming Vanity.description: As an action, a creature that flatters the hag forces it to succeed on a DC 17 Charisma saving throw or be &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] until the end of the hag’s next turn.

Harrying Wings.name: Harrying Wings
Harrying Wings.description: When the hag rolls initiative, it is surrounded by fey spirits in the form of angry pigeons. The hag’s enemies within 10 feet of it have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. This trait doesn’t function if the hag is &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false].

Coven Magic.name: 集会魔法
Coven Magic.description:
While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MVzM1hRdci2imGdJ]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{Unseen Servant}. The hag must finish a long rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

The Brimstone Behemoth.name: The Brimstone Behemoth
The Brimstone Behemoth.description:
The Brimstone Behemoth

Apocalyptic Colossus of Hellfire

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Underground

The emergence of the Brimstone Behemoth means armageddon for whatever realm it erupts into. A Fiend as old as time itself, it is made of hellfire, brimstone, and dying worlds. It has a malevolent will that seeks only to bring about mass extinction and apocalypse. The only hope for many civilizations has been through the regular willing sacrifice of citizens to slow or delay the inevitable doom to come.

Secret. If a soul willingly perishes in flame or lava to ensure the behemoth’s demise, the Fiend will find its flame quenched.

The Brimstone Behemoth’s Lair

The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP).

The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Relentless Blaze. Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava. A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).name: Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day)
Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).description: The Brimstone Behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.x5JNBSyIBBZsjcGT]{Earthquake} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.mF52ldF79Cr7wfQo]{Meteor Swarm}, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24).

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Bite]] attack, and it makes two Claw or Blazing Boulder attacks in any combination.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is &Reference[Grappled apply=false] (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false].

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blazing Boulder.name: Blazing Boulder
Blazing Boulder.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: The behemoth can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The behemoth regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Fire Rain.name: Fire Rain
Fire Rain.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Blazing Boulder]] attack.

Trample.name: 践踏
Trample.description: The behemoth moves up to half its speed, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack. On a hit, if the target is a creature, it is knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Lava Well.name: Lava Well
Lava Well.description: The behemoth causes lava to cover the ground in its space and in any unoccupied spaces in any tunnels it left by burrowing within 100 feet. A creature that touches the lava for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in the lava takes 55 ([[/r 10d10]]) fire damage. A creature takes this damage only once per round. The lava cools and hardens after 1 hour or when the behemoth uses this action again.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP). The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Relentless Blaze.name: Relentless Blaze
Relentless Blaze.description: Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava.name: Tenacious Lava
Tenacious Lava.description: A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 ([[/r 1d6]]) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Hellish Rebuke.name: 炼狱叱喝
Hellish Rebuke.description: When the behemoth is damaged by a creature it can see within 60 feet of it, it casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.22dPoeXfaaAv4K3h]{Hellish Rebuke} on the creature, using the same spellcasting ability as Cataclysmic Spellcasting.

Burning Sacrifice.name: Burning Sacrifice
Burning Sacrifice.description: If a creature willingly sacrifices its life in fire or lava for the purpose of defeating the behemoth, the creature can’t be returned to life by any means. For the next 24 hours, the behemoth has disadvantage on ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws, its speed is halved, it has vulnerability to radiant damage, and it loses its Legendary Resistance trait.

Consuming Flame.name: Consuming Flame
Consuming Flame.description: When the behemoth deals fire damage, it can choose to deal necrotic damage instead.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: Magic Resistance
Magic Resistance.description: The behemoth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Siege Monster.name: 攻城怪物
Siege Monster.description: The behemoth deals double damage to objects and structures.

Tunneler.name: 掘道者
Tunneler.description: The behemoth can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 20-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.name: Hellish Rebuke
R1BQinrzA1doIVzQ.description:
当一个 60 尺内的你可见的生物对你造成伤害，你指向对方，伤害你的生物立刻被地狱的烈焰席卷。该生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免，豁免失败则受到 2d10 火焰伤害，豁免成功则受到一半伤害。

升环施法： 使用的法术位每比一环高一环，此法术的伤害就增加 1d10 点。

activation.condition: 当 60 尺内一个你能看见的生物对你造成伤害时执行

Earthquake.name: 地震术earthquake
Earthquake.description:
You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the Duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Concentration is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

This spell can have additional Effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the Nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become buried.

materials.value: 一撮泥土、一块岩石和一团粘土。

Meteor Swarm.name: 流星爆Meteor Swarm
Meteor Swarm.description:
熊熊燃烧的火球坠向施法范围内你能看见的四个不同地点。以每个选定点为中心，40尺半径球状区域内的每个生物必须进行一次敏捷豁免。该球状区域会绕过拐角扩散。豁免失败时，一个生物受到20d6火焰伤害和20d6钝击伤害，豁免成功则只受一半伤害。处于多个火焰爆发区域内的生物仅会受到一次影响。

该法术会伤害区域内的物件，并点燃未被穿着或携带的可燃物。

Club.name: 短棒
Club.description: [[/attack extended]]. [[/damage average extended]].

Training.name: 技艺受训
Training.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 具有某项技能熟练（由DM选择），且在进行使用该技能的属性检定时具有优势。

YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ.name: Drakkenhob
YanMa8w09aAgP7oZ.description:
Drakkenhob

Dragon Disguised as a Festival Horse

Habitat: Grasslands, Hills, Urban

Treasure: Any

The drakkenhob is a draconic monster with a sinister disguise, presenting itself as an actor wearing a horse costume, such as a mounted knight or a festively clad rider. Its draconic head resembles a decorated or armored horse’s head, and its sharp teeth fit together to appear like blunt, harmless decorations. The drakkenhob uses this benign guise to get close to its prey, which are typically within crowds near festivals or parades, before it summons its similarly garbed hunting hounds and strikes. Its breath is a blood-curdling wave of terror that makes lesser victims drop dead from fright alone.

Secret. Unable to resist revelry and merriment, drakkenhob are driven away by payment offered in gold or alcohol.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The drakkenhob makes two [[/item Rend]] attacks.

Rend.name: 撕裂
Rend.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Terrifying Breath.name: Terrifying Breath
Terrifying Breath.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 15, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target drops whatever it is holding and has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition. A Frightened target takes the Dash action and moves away from the drakkenhob by the safest route on each of its turns unless there’s nowhere to move. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Success: Half damage only.

Call The Hounds.name: Call The Hounds
Call The Hounds.description: The drakkenhob lets out a wolf-like howl and magically summons three hunting hounds (use the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.monsters.Actor.yawTeS8u2FCfzzZH]{Wolf} stat block) that appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of it. The hounds take their turn immediately after the drakkenhob on the same Initiative count, and they obey the drakkenhob’s mental commands. The hounds vanish when they or the drakkenhob drop to 0 Hit Points, or when the drakkenhob uses this Bonus Action again.

Irresistible Payment.name: Irresistible Payment
Irresistible Payment.description: As an Influence action, a creature that offers the drakkenhob alcohol or any amount of gold and succeeds on a DC 16 Charisma (Persuasion) check forces the drakkenhob to accept the offer and immediately take a Reaction to move up to half its Speed to get away from the creature by the safest route possible.

YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA.name: The Tall Man
YlLuWhpb0HwH9nzA.description:
The Tall Man

Murderous Archfey of the Dark Wood

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey)

The Tall Man is a mysterious entity that haunts an accursed forest. Once, he was an archfey who ruled a now-forgotten court, renowned for its dances that lasted for nights on end. Doomed now to walk his rotting forest, the Tall Man finds pleasure where he can by tempting travelers and forest denizens alike to play hide and seek with him—with deadly results.

Secret. Dancing forgotten steps once performed in the fey court that the Tall Man formerly ruled shreds his being.

The Tall Man’s Lair

The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP).

The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects:

Deepening Shadows. Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet. Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description: The Tall Man uses Spellcasting.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The Tall Man makes two [[/item Claw]] attacks and uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Vicious Mockery ([[/r 4d6]] psychic damage).

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it has the &reference[Grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from one of two claws, and has the &reference[Restrained apply=false] condition until the grapple ends.

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: The Tall Man can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The Tall Man regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Teleport.name: 传送
Teleport.description: The Tall Man teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space he can see. When he teleports, he can force a creature he is grappling to succeed on a DC 18 Charisma saving throw or teleport with him, appearing in the closest unoccupied space to the Tall Man’s destination.

Strike.name: 猛击
Strike.description: The Tall Man makes one [[/item Claw]] attack, then can’t take this action again until the start of his next turn.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: The Tall Man’s lair is the dark forest he now haunts, where his forgotten Fey court once thrived. If encountered in his lair, the Tall Man has a challenge rating of 21 (33,000 XP). The region containing the Tall Man’s lair is changed by his presence, creating the following effects: If the Tall Man dies or moves his lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Deepening Shadows.name: Deepening Shadows
Deepening Shadows.description: Within 1 mile of the lair, shadows stretch far beyond what they should. Creatures can find a sufficiently shadowy spot to hide in, even without cover, 50 percent of the time.

Too Quiet.name: Too Quiet
Too Quiet.description: Sounds are muffled within 1 mile of the lair, halving the distance at which sounds can be heard.

Elusive Disguise.name: Elusive Disguise
Elusive Disguise.description: The Tall Man magically transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back to his true form. His statistics, other than his size, are the same in each form. Any equipment he is wearing or carrying changes to accommodate his new form. He can take on any features he chooses, but he is always unnaturally tall for whatever guise he takes. He returns to his true form if he dies.

Evasive Blink.name: Evasive Blink
Evasive Blink.description: When the Tall Man takes damage, he gains resistance to the triggering damage and teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the Tall Man fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The Tall Man has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Memory’s Dance.name: Memory’s Dance
Memory’s Dance.description: As a Bonus Action, a creature can perform some steps from a dance of the Tall Man’s court and make a DC 20 Charisma (Performance) check. On a success, the Tall Man takes 20 Force damage and has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the start of the creature’s next turn.

RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.name: Spellcasting
RcNFXsC5dOf3CAKy.description:
Spellcasting. The Tall Man casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMinorIllus]{Minor Illusion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplViciousMoc]{Vicious Mockery} (4d6 Psychic damage)

2/Day: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDarkness00]{Darkness}

Invisibility.name: Invisibility
Invisibility.description:
A creature you touch has the &Reference[invisible apply=false] condition until the spell ends. The spell ends early immediately after the target makes an attack roll, deals damage, or casts a spell.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. You can target one additional creature for each spell slot level above 2.

materials.value: 一根包裹在阿拉伯胶中的睫毛

Invisible.name: 隐形
Invisible.description: 如果你进行攻击检定、造成伤害或施展法术，则该法术提前终止。

Minor Illusion.name: 次级幻象
Minor Illusion.description:
你在施法距离内创造一段声响或一个物件的影像，并使之维持至法术持续时间结束，详见以下对应效应的描述。你可以再次施展该法术来终止幻象。

生物用研究动作调查该声响或影像时，其必须进行一次对抗该法术豁免 DC 的[[/check ability=int skill=inv dc=@attributes.spelldc]]检定，检定成功则判断出是幻象。对于识破幻象的生物而言，幻象会变得模糊不清。

声响。 如果你创造一段声响，其音量可以是低声耳语也可以是高声尖叫。它可以是你或其他任何人的嗓音，或者是一头狮子的咆哮、一段鼓声以及任何你指定的其他声响。声响在持续时间内不会减弱，或者你也可以于法术终止前在不同的时间段创造几段分散的声响。

影像。 如果你创造一个物件的影像，比如一把椅子、泥泞的脚印、一个小箱子等，则该物件各方向上大小不得大于 5 尺立方区域。该影像不具有声音、光亮、味道或任何其他的感官效应。由于影像可以被任何物体穿透，因此与之进行物理互动时都会揭露其幻象的本质。

Vicious Mockery.name: Vicious Mockery
Vicious Mockery.description:
你对施法距离内一名你可见或可听的生物连珠炮式地释出一串蕴涵微妙惑控的侮辱。目标必须成功于一次感知豁免，否则受到 1d6 点心灵伤害，且其下一回合结束前进行的下一次攻击检定具有劣势。

戏法强化： 你到达特定等级时，其伤害增加 1d6（5 级2 d6、11 级 3d6、17 级 4d6）

Mocked.name: 嘲弄
Mocked.description: 你的下一回合结束前进行的下一次攻击检定具有劣势。

Darkness.name: 黑暗术
Darkness.description:
你指定施法距离内一点，并在法术持续时间内使魔法性&Reference[darkness]{黑暗}斥以该点为中心半径 15 尺的球状区域。黑暗视觉也无法看穿这这种黑暗，非魔法的光照也无法将其照亮。

或者，你可以将此法术施展于一个未被着装或携带的物件上，使黑暗充斥以该物件为中心的 15 尺光环区域。将该物件用不透明的东西遮掩（比如用碗或头盔盖住）时，会将黑暗隔绝。

如果法术区域与任何二环或更低环阶法术创造的明亮光照或微光光照区域重叠，则这些造光的法术将被解除。

YrHNHb9ZwdMqv3KC.name: Weasel Hag
YrHNHb9ZwdMqv3KC.description:
Weasel Hag

Hag of Soul Twisting and Terror

Habitat: Forest, Planar (Fey), Urban

Covetous and bedecked in stolen and gifted teeth, weasel hags are Fey creatures that sow nightmares and temptation to wickedness. They often surround themselves with weasels and boogleswarms, using them as spies, thieves to steal trinkets (especially lost teeth), and to spread their malign influence.

Secret. Weasel hags’ love of teeth goes beyond a mere quirk. They can’t refuse a tooth willingly given by its owner and can’t harm the owner for a time.

Blindness/Deafness.name: 目盲术/耳聋术
Blindness/Deafness.description:
你可以使一名敌人目盲或耳聋。选择射程内一个你能看见的单一生物进行一次体质豁免。若豁免失败，目标将在法术持续时间内陷入&Reference[blinded]或&Reference[deafened]状态(由你选择)。在每个自己的回合结束时，目标可以进行一次体质豁免。若豁免成功，则法术终止。

升环施法效应。施展该法术时，若你使用的法术位达到3环或更高，则使用的法术位每比2环高一级，你就能额外多影响一个生物。

Blindness.name: 目盲
Blindness.description: 目标在法术持续时间内陷入目盲。在每个自己的回合结束时，目标可以进行一次体质豁免。豁免成功则法术终止。

Deafness.name: 耳聋
Deafness.description: 目标在该法术的持续时间内陷入耳聋。在每个自己的回合结束时，目标可以进行一次体质豁免。若豁免成功，则该法术终止。

Detect Magic.name: 侦测魔法
Detect Magic.description: 你在法术持续时间内能感测到 30 尺内存在的魔法。感测到魔法的存在后，你可以使用动作，来看到任何你能看见的具有魔法的生物或物件周围环绕着微弱的灵光，并分辨出其所属的魔法学派（若有）。该法术可以穿透大部分障碍，但仍会被 1 尺厚石质，或 1 寸厚金属质，或一层薄铅质，或 3 尺厚木质或泥质材料阻隔。

Ray of Enfeeblement.name: 衰弱射线
Ray of Enfeeblement.description:
你从指尖射出一道让人衰弱的黑色能量射线并射向施法距离内的一个生物。你对目标进行一次远程法术攻击。若命中，则目标在法术终止前，其使用基于力量的武器进行攻击时只造成一半伤害。

目标在其每回合结束时可以进行一次对抗该法术的体质豁免。豁免成功则法术终止。

Confusion.name: 困惑术
Confusion.description:
该法术冲击并扭曲生物的心智，滋生妄想并引发失控行为。当你施展该法术时，在你选择射程内一点为圆心、半径10尺球状区域内的每个生物必须进行一次感知豁免，豁免失败则受其影响。

受影响的目标无法执行反应，并在其每回合开始时必须从@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.tables.RollTable.LHEts1oDaDwcehuj]{困惑术 Confusion}表中骰出结果来决定其该回合的行为。

升环施法效应。 当你用五环或更高法术位施展该法术时，球状区域的半径你使用的法术位每四环高一环增加5尺。

Dream.name: 托梦术
Dream.description:
此法术塑造一个生物的梦境。选择一个你所认识的生物作为法术目标。该目标必须与你在同一存在位面。不睡觉的生物，例如精灵，无法被该法术影响。你，或一个你所接触的自愿生物，进入一种恍惚状态，扮演信使的角色。在恍惚状态下，信使能感知其周围环境，但不能采取动作或移动。

如果目标已睡着，信使将出现在目标的梦境中，并且只要目标保持睡眠状态，信使便可在法术持续时间内与目标交谈。信使还可以塑造梦境环境，创造风景、物体和其他景象。信使可以在任何时候脱离恍惚状态，提前结束法术效果。目标醒来后能完美地回忆起梦境。如果施法时目标是清醒的，信使会知道这一点，并可以选择结束恍惚状态（及法术），或者等待目标入睡，届时信使将出现在目标的梦境中。

你可以让信使以一个可怖且吓人的形态出现在目标面前。如果你这么做，信使可以传递不超过十个词的信息，然后目标必须进行一次感知豁免。豁免失败，幻象怪物的回响会生成一个噩梦，持续目标睡眠的整个时间，并使目标无法从这次休息中获得任何益处。此外，当目标醒来时，它会受到 3d6 点心灵伤害。

如果你拥有目标身体的一部分，如一缕头发、一片指甲或类似的身体部分，则目标进行豁免时处于劣势。

Waking Terrors.name: Waking Terrors
Waking Terrors.description: The hag assaults the mind of one creature it can see within 30 feet of itself. The target must make a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw (with disadvantage If the hag has one of the target’s teeth). On a failed save, the target takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) psychic damage and is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] for 1 minute. While &Reference[Frightened apply=false] in this way, the target perceives its allies as enemies born from its nightmares, but it isn’t compelled to act against or harm them. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. At the end of each of its turns, a &Reference[Frightened apply=false] target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success.

Shape-shift.name: Shape-shift
Shape-shift.description: The hag shape-shifts to resemble a Tiny weasel (walking speed 30 ft., climbing speed 30 ft.) or a Small or Medium Humanoid, or back into her true form. Her game statistics, other than her speed as a weasel and her size, are the same in each form. Any equipment she is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed.

Biting Gift.name: Biting Gift
Biting Gift.description: If a creature willingly offers one of its teeth to the hag, the hag must accept it and be &Reference[Charmed apply=false] for 24 hours, or until the creature or its allies deal damage to the hag or force it to make a saving throw.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Coven Magic.name: 集会魔法
Coven Magic.description:
While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

@UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2014.tcm2014-player-options.Item.MVzM1hRdci2imGdJ]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.ccduLIvutyNqvkgv]{Unseen Servant}. The hag must finish a long rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Animate Trees.description:
该树人魔法性地活化其60尺内可见的一或两棵树。这些树木拥有与树人相同的资料卡，但它们的智力和魅力值为1，不能说话，且只有猛击动作选项。

活化树木作为树人的盟友行动。树木保持活化状态1天或直到其死亡；或直到树人死亡或与树木相距超过120尺；或直到树人使用附赠动作将其变回非活化树木。随后该树木若条件允许便会扎根。

False Appearance.name: 拟形
False Appearance.description: 当树人静止不动时，它与普通的树木一模一样。

Multiattack.description: 该树人发动两次猛击攻击。

Treant - Rock.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Siege Monster.name: 攻城怪物
Siege Monster.description: 该树人对物体和结构造成双倍伤害。

Slam.name: 粗枝猛击
Slam.description: Melee Weapon Attack:+10 to hit,, 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

Vampires

Spider Climb.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 可以在难以攀爬的表面上攀爬，包括沿着天花板移动，且不需要为此进行属性检定。

Deathless Agility.name: 不死者机敏

Vampire Weakness.name: 吸血鬼弱点
Vampire Weakness.description:
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] has these weaknesses:

Forbiddance. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't enter a residence without an invitation from an occupant.

Running Water. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

Stake to the Heart. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is destroyed if a weapon that deals Piercing damage is driven into the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s heart while the [[lookup @name lowercase]] has the Incapacitated condition.

Sunlight. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] takes 20 Radiant damage if it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has Disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

Disadv. Attacks & Checks.name: 劣势：攻击和检定
Disadv. Attacks & Checks.description: 若你身处阳光下，你进行的属性检定和攻击检定具有劣势。

ZpqpWxE5kzFjsW72.name: The Brimstone Behemoth
ZpqpWxE5kzFjsW72.description:
The Brimstone Behemoth

Apocalyptic Colossus of Hellfire

Habitat: Planar (Lower Planes), Underground

Treasure: None

The emergence of the Brimstone Behemoth means armageddon for whatever realm it erupts into. A Fiend as old as time itself, it is made of hellfire, brimstone, and dying worlds. It has a malevolent will that seeks only to bring about mass extinction and apocalypse. The only hope for many civilizations has been through the regular willing sacrifice of citizens to slow or delay the inevitable doom to come.

Secret. If a soul willingly perishes in flame or lava to ensure the behemoth’s demise, the Fiend will find its flame quenched.

The Brimstone Behemoth’s Lair

The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair. If encountered in its lair, the Brimstone Behemoth has a challenge rating of 26 (90,000 XP).

The region containing the Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Relentless Blaze. Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava. A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the fire takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 3 (1d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

If the Brimstone Behemoth dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).name: Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day)
Cataclysmic Spellcasting (1/Day).description: The Brimstone Behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEarthquake]{Earthquake} and @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplMeteorSwar]{Meteor Swarm}, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 24).

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Bite]] attack, and it makes two Claw or Blazing Boulder attacks in any combination.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 20). Until the grapple ends, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Claw.name: 爪击
Claw.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 15 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

Blazing Boulder.name: Blazing Boulder
Blazing Boulder.description: Ranged Attack Roll: [[/attack]], range 150 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[prone apply=false] condition.

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: Legendary Action Uses: 3 (4 in Lair). Immediately after another creature’s turn, the behemoth can expend a use to take one of the following actions. The behemoth regains all expended uses at the start of each of its turns.

Fire Rain.name: Fire Rain
Fire Rain.description: The behemoth makes one [[/item Blazing Boulder]] attack.

Trample.name: 践踏
Trample.description: The behemoth moves up to half its Speed, and it makes one [[/item Claw]] attack. On a hit, if the target is a creature, it has the Prone condition.

Lava Well.name: Lava Well
Lava Well.description: The behemoth causes lava to cover the ground in its space and in any unoccupied spaces in any tunnels it left by burrowing within 100 feet. A creature that touches the lava for the first time on a turn or starts its turn in the lava takes [[/damage average]]damage. A creature takes this damage only once per round. The lava cools and hardens after 1 hour or when the behemoth uses this action again. The behemoth can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作

The Brimstone Behemoth’s lair is a vast underground cavern filled with magma, flames, and smoke. Once this colossus awakens, the crater that its cavern becomes serves as its lair.

Relentless Blaze.name: Relentless Blaze
Relentless Blaze.description: Within 10 miles of the lair, flames become driven to spread and consume. Every hour, contained fires in that area have a 10 percent chance of spreading to a flammable object within 10 feet. Uncontained fires spread out of control in 10 minutes.

Tenacious Lava.name: Tenacious Lava
Tenacious Lava.description: A creature that takes damage from lava within 1 mile of the lair starts burning, and it takes [[/damage average]] damage instead of 1d4 when it burns.

Hellish Rebuke.name: 炼狱叱喝
Hellish Rebuke.description: The behemoth casts @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHellishReb]{Hellish Rebuke} in response to that spell’s trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Cataclysmic Spellcasting.

Burning Sacrifice.name: Burning Sacrifice
Burning Sacrifice.description: If a creature willingly sacrifices its life in fire or lava for the purpose of defeating the behemoth, the creature can’t be returned to life by any means. For the next 24 hours, the behemoth has Disadvantage on D20 Tests, its Speed is halved, it has Vulnerability to Radiant damage, and it loses its Legendary Resistance trait.

Consuming Flame.description: When the behemoth deals Fire damage, it can choose to deal Necrotic damage instead.

Legendary Resistance.description: (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair). If the behemoth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The behemoth has Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

Siege Monster.name: 攻城怪物

Earthquake.name: 地震术earthquake
Earthquake.description:
You create a seismic disturbance at a point on the ground that you can see within range. For the Duration, an intense tremor rips through the ground in a 100-foot-radius circle centered on that point and shakes creatures and structures in contact with the ground in that area.

The ground in the area becomes difficult terrain. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's Concentration is broken.

When you cast this spell and at the end of each turn you spend concentrating on it, each creature on the ground in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is knocked prone.

This spell can have additional Effects depending on the terrain in the area, as determined by the DM.

Fissures. Fissures open throughout the spell's area at the start of your next turn after you cast the spell. A total of 1d6 such fissures open in locations chosen by the DM. Each is 1d10 × 10 feet deep, 10 feet wide, and extends from one edge of the spell's area to the opposite side. A creature standing on a spot where a fissure opens must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

A fissure that opens beneath a structure causes it to automatically collapse (see below).

Structures. The tremor deals 50 bludgeoning damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the start of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses and potentially damages nearby creatures. A creature within half the distance of a structure's height must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage, is knocked prone, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a DC 20 Strength (Athletics) check as an action to escape. The DM can adjust the DC higher or lower, depending on the Nature of the rubble. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and doesn't fall prone or become buried.

materials.value: 一撮泥土、一块岩石和一团粘土。

该法术会伤害区域内的物件，并点燃未被穿着或携带的可燃物。

When you cast this spell and at the end of each of your turns for the duration, each creature on the ground in the area makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature has the &Reference[Prone] condition, and its Concentration is broken.

You can also cause the effects below.

Fissures. A total of [[/r 1d6]] fissures open in the spell's area at the end of the turn you cast it. You choose the fissures' locations, which can't be under structures. Each fissure is [[/r 1d10 * 10]] feet deep and 10 feet wide, and it extends from one edge of the spell's area to another edge. A creature in the same space as a fissure must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall in. A creature that successfully saves moves with the fissure's edge as it opens.

Structures. The tremor deals [[/damage 50 type=bludgeoning]] damage to any structure in contact with the ground in the area when you cast the spell and at the end of each of your turns until the spell ends. If a structure drops to 0 Hit Points, it collapses.

A creature within a distance from a collapsing structure equal to half the structure's height makes a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 12d6 Bludgeoning damage, has the &Reference[Prone apply=false] condition, and is buried in the rubble, requiring a [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=20]] check as an action to escape. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only.

Collapsing Structure Save.name: 坍塌豁免
Collapsing Structure Save.condition: 建筑生命值降为 0 时

Buried in Rubble.name: 废墟埋葬
Buried in Rubble.description: 你进行一次敏捷豁免。豁免失败则受 12d6 点钝击伤害并陷入 &Reference[Prone apply=false] 态且被埋于废墟之下。该生物可用一个动作通过一次 [[/check ability=str skill=ath dc=20]] 检定来尝试逃离废墟。

IurmlhaTiUP9vDUv.name: Meteor Swarm
IurmlhaTiUP9vDUv.description:
Blazing orbs of fire plummet to the ground at four different points you can see within range. Each creature in a 40-foot-radius Sphere centered on each of those points makes a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 20d6 Fire damage and 20d6 Bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature in the area of more than one fiery Sphere is affected only once.

A nonmagical object that isn't being worn or carried also takes the damage if it's in the spell's area, and the object starts burning if it's flammable.

ZbV0dDJckyANvxI7.name: Hellish Rebuke
ZbV0dDJckyANvxI7.description:
The creature that damaged you is momentarily surrounded by green flames. It makes a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 Fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot. The damage increases by 1d10 for each spell slot level above 1.

Serum Brute.name: Serum Brute
Serum Brute.description:
Serum Brute

Cursed Giant Enhanced by Alchemy

Habitat: Underground, Urban

Treasure: Any

Serum brutes are descended from giants who suffered an enduring curse when they failed to take over a Fey domain. They have third eyes, usually in their foreheads, which channel the giants’ curse into the world around them. All three of their eyes are sewn or otherwise sealed shut to contain the curse. Serum brutes are further enhanced with—and get their name from—a series of alchemical infusions, often delivered through implanted vessels and tubes, which seek to deaden their sorrow and pain, as well as the disturbing power of their third eyes. They form deep emotional bonds with any who offer them comfort and an escape from the pain of their curse, and they are often willing to die for those allies.

Secret. Serum brutes are dependent upon their curse, and magic that breaks curses can leave the giants debilitated and bereft.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The brute makes two [[/item Fist]] attacks and can use Cursed Gaze if available.

Fist.name: 拳击
Fist.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 10 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If Caustic Secretion is active, the target takes an extra 11 ([[/r 2d10]]) Acid damage.

Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only).description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 16, each creature in a 30-foot Cone.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the brute’s next turn.

Success: Half damage only.

Devotion.name: 虔信者
Devotion.description:
Trigger: An ally within 5 feet takes damage.

Response: The ally gains Resistance to the triggering damage, and the brute takes an amount of Psychic damage equal to the damage the ally takes.

Curse Dependent.name: Curse Dependent
Curse Dependent.description: If the brute is targeted by a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.XZhdgVK3cLoxNCQl]{Remove Curse} spell or similar magic, until it finishes a Long Rest, the brute loses its Blindsight, its [[/item Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Withering Eye} trait, and its [[/item Cursed Gaze (Unleashed Eyes Only)]]{Cursed Gaze} action.

Stimulant Rush.name: Stimulant Rush
Stimulant Rush.description:
At the start of its turn, the brute must choose one of the following options (it can’t use that option twice in a row):

  • Catalyst Infusion. Until the start of its next turn, the brute’s Speed increases to 50 feet, it doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it leaves an enemy’s reach, and its Long Jump is up to 30 feet and its High Jump is up to 15 feet with or without a running start.

  • Caustic Secretion. Until the start of its next turn,
    its Fist attack deals an extra [[/damage average]] damage.

  • Stim Boost. Gain 10 Temporary Hit Points.

Unleashed Eyes.name: Unleashed Eyes
Unleashed Eyes.description: When the brute is Bloodied, its sealed eyes rip open and unleash its curse. It is no longer blind beyond 60 feet, and it can use its Withering Eye trait and Cursed Gaze action until it finishes a Long Rest, whereupon its eyes seal shut again.

Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).name: Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only)
Withering Eye (Unleashed Eyes Only).description: When the brute moves to within 5 feet of a creature, the creature takes [[/damage average]] damage. A creature takes this damage only once per turn.

Wayward Haint.name: Wayward Haint
Wayward Haint.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Treasure: None

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. This can’t raise the target’s Exhaustion level above 5, and all Exhaustion levels gained from this action end when the target finishes a Short or Long Rest, or if it receives a @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.F0GsG0SJzsIOacwV]{Lesser Restoration} spell or similar magic

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were Difficult Terrain. It takes [[/damage average]] damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

aHAfPdP24eevOUSO.name: Wormhost Surgeon
aHAfPdP24eevOUSO.description:
Wormhost Surgeon

Parasitical Physician

Habitat: Any

Alien parasitic worms that infest the brains of Humanoid bodies mutate their hosts into wormhost surgeons. These aberrant husks are obsessed with anatomical study and with finding new Humanoids to infest with larval worm slurry to propagate their kind. They can pass for ordinary people in most cases but must take care to hide their exposed brains and the wriggling worms within their flesh.

Secret. Wormhost surgeons are drawn to seek out and infest sapient victims, so intelligent creatures with veiled minds slip beneath the surgeons’ notice.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The surgeon makes two [[/item Bone Saw]] attacks.

Bone Saw.name: Bone Saw
Bone Saw.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. On a critical hit, if the target is a creature, its Intelligence score decreases by [[/r 1d4]]. The target dies if this reduces that score to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

Infested Spray.name: Infested Spray
Infested Spray.description: The surgeon unleashes a spray of worm-ridden cerebral fluid in a 20-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 17 ([[/r 5d6]]) psychic damage, and it is infested with larval parasitic worms. An infested target takes 7 (2d6) psychic damage at the end of each of its turns as the worms burrow toward its brain. The ongoing damage ends when the target takes poison damage or is targeted by an effect that ends the &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] condition. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage only. If the target is reduced to 0 hit points by this psychic damage, the worms reach its brain and it dies. A Humanoid slain in this way rises 24 hours later as a wormhost surgeon.

Protective Parasite.name: Protective Parasite
Protective Parasite.description: When the surgeon is reduced to 0 hit points, the parasite worm emerges from the surgeon’s exposed brain and spits acid in a 20-foot-long, 5-foot-wide line. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ([[/r 3d6]]) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The surgeon regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If it takes poison damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The surgeon dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

Veiled Ignorance.name: Veiled Ignorance
Veiled Ignorance.description: A creature whose mind can’t be read, or that is under the effect of a Mind Blank or Nondetection spell, becomes &Reference[Invisible apply=false] toward the surgeon (this ignores the surgeon’s blindsight).

Multiattack.description: [[lookup @name lowercase]] 发动两次 [[/item .yf1Nf7oPWS4arOOL]] 攻击。

Etherealness.description: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] casts the @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplEtherealne]{Etherealness} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.name: 以太化
88qd0Ulz7AMzouDU.description:
You step into the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain in the Border Ethereal for the duration. During this time, you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can perceive the plane you left, which looks gray, and you can't see anything there more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can affect and be affected only by creatures, objects, and effects on that plane. Creatures that aren't on the Ethereal Plane can't perceive or interact with you unless a feature gives them the ability to do so.

When the spell ends, you return to the plane you left in the spot that corresponds to your space in the Border Ethereal. If you appear in an occupied space, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space and take Force damage equal to twice the number of feet you are moved.

This spell ends instantly if you cast it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn't border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot.You can target up to three willing creatures (including yourself) for each spell slot level above 7. The creatures must be within 10 feet of you when you cast the spell.

Horrific Visage.name: 恐惧面容
Horrific Visage.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]], each creature in a [[lookup @target.template.size activity=v8KiqUloIE5eocSu]]-foot Cone that can see the [[lookup @name lowercase]] and isn't an Undead.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition until the start of the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s next turn.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Horrifying Visage for 24 hours.

Frightened.name: 恐慌
Frightened.description: 你陷入 &Reference[Frightened apply=false] 状态，直至幽魂的下一回合开始。

Possession.name: 附身
Possession.description:
Charisma Saving Throw: DC [[lookup @save.dc.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]], one [[lookup @target.affects.special activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] the [[lookup @name lowercase]] can see within [[lookup @range.value activity=7gmNBVjwuYTyANMe]] feet.

Failure: The target is possessed by the [[lookup @name lowercase]]; the [[lookup @name lowercase]] disappears, and the target has the &Reference[Incapacitated apply=false] condition and loses control of its body. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The [[lookup @name lowercase]] can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the [[lookup @name lowercase]] leaves as a Bonus Action. When the possession ends, the [[lookup @name lowercase]] appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

Success: The target is immune to this [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s Possession for 24 hours.

bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6.name: Boneflayer
bdayUVvMhDxmeOI6.description:
Boneflayer

Voracious Carrion Eater

Habitat: Desert, Forest, Grassland, Mountain

Treasure: Any

Boneflayers are cruel, vulture-like creatures that originated from a broken fey pact. The creatures aren’t content to wait for something to die and instead make their own carrion to gorge upon—they delight in snatching prey in their talons, carrying it into the air, and dropping it to its death. Boneflayers earn their name by using their sizeable, filth-riddled beaks to cleave flesh from bone and hoard the meat until it ages enough for them to enjoy.

Cults sometimes use boneflayer killing grounds as a source of bones to burn in ritual bonfires, occasionally making pacts with the creatures to pay or trade for the creature’s castoffs. Villages that fear boneflayer attacks ward them off with thundering drums or gongs whenever they circle overhead.

Secret. A lingering result of the fey bargain that created them, boneflayers are disoriented and diminished by loud, thunderous noises.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The boneflayer makes one [[/item Beak]] attack and one [[/item Talons]] attack.

Beak.name: 喙啄
Beak.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the end of its next turn.

Talons.name: 禽爪
Talons.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the &reference[grappled apply=false] condition (escape DC 14) from both talons. While Grappled, the target has the &reference[restrained apply=false] condition.

Swoop.name: 鹏落
Swoop.description: If the boneflayer has a creature &reference[grappled apply=false], the boneflayer flies up to half its Fly Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks and drops that creature.

Flyby.name: 飞掠
Flyby.description: The boneflayer doesn’t provoke an Opportunity Attack when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Thunderous Ward.name: Thunderous Ward
Thunderous Ward.description: When the boneflayer hears a drum or gong, or takes Thunder damage, it has Disadvantage on D20 Tests until the end of its next turn.

biUIdaM38Bn9Dbme.name: The Sweetheart
biUIdaM38Bn9Dbme.description:
Wayward Haint

Lost Soul Bound to Regret

Habitat: Any

Wayward haints are restless spirits stuck between the realms of the living and the dead. Be it a curse or an unresolved conflict from their previous life, a haint can’t rest until their unfinished business is resolved.

Haints only show hints of who they were in life, taking on a more symbolic form related to the hurt or loss they can’t let go of. They tend to repeat their monotonous actions—often imitating those performed in life or reenacting their sorrow—over and over for eternity. When provoked, they can display a volatile temper and lash out with a crushing wave of the grief and indecision that binds their spirit.

Secret. Wayward haints can be trapped in empty bottles if they’re tricked or forced to pass over one.

Draining Regret.name: Draining Regret
Draining Regret.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 level of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false]. This can’t raise the target’s &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] level above 5, and all levels of &Reference[Exhaustion apply=false] gained from this action end when the target finishes a short or long rest, or if it receives a Lesser Restoration spell or similar magic.

Bottle Trap.name: Bottle Trap
Bottle Trap.description: A haint that enters the space of an upright, empty bottle must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be drawn into the bottle, and a cork or stopper appears to close the bottle. The trapped haint can see and hear through the bottle out to 10 feet, and any creature in that range can hear the haint. The haint is released if the bottle breaks or another creature opens it.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The haint can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside a solid object.

The Galloping Headsman.name: The Galloping Headsman
The Galloping Headsman.description:
The Galloping Headsman

Headless Executioner of Vengeance

Habitat: Forest, Grassland, Hill, Urban

The Galloping Headsman is a formidable combination of human and horse musculature fused with nightmarish magic and dark revenge. Gouts of flame burst from where its head and tail should be and dance dangerously along the edge of its massive two-headed axe. A burning, skull-shaped pumpkin floats eerily in one hand, its fiery visage a constantly shifting train of agonized faces.

Secret. The Galloping Headsman’s original skull is its greatest weakness, and anyone holding the skull becomes the apparition’s bane.

The Galloping Headsman’s Lair

The Galloping Headsman’s lair is the stretch of road that serves as the anchor point of the creature’s search for vengeance. If encountered in his lair, the Galloping Headsman has a challenge rating of 19 (22,000 XP).

The region containing the Galloping Headsman’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects:

Encroaching Doom. Within 6 miles of the lair, an air of doom clings to creatures. Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the frightened condition that aren’t caused by the Galloping Headsman.

Interminable Journey. Paths warp and stretch within 6 miles of the lair. In that area, travel pace outside of combat is halved.

If the Galloping Headsman dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The headsman makes two [[/item Headsman’s Axe]] attacks and one [[/item Hooves]] attack.

Headsman’s Axe.name: Headsman’s Axe
Headsman’s Axe.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a creature with at least one head and the headsman rolled a 20 on the attack roll, the target must succeed on a DC 20 Constitution saving throw or it is decapitated and dies if it can’t survive without a head. A target is immune to this effect if it takes none of the damage, has Legendary Actions, or is Huge or larger. Such a creature takes an extra [[/damage 8d6 Force]] damage from the hit.

Hooves.name: 蹄击
Hooves.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the headsman moved at least 20 feet immediately before the hit, the target takes an extra [[/damage 2d8 Necrotic]] damage and has the &reference[Prone apply=false] condition.

Flaming Skull.name: Flaming Skull
Flaming Skull.description:
The headsman hurls its skull, after which it reappears in the headsman’s hand.

Dexterity Saving Throw: DC 20, each creature in a 90-foot-long, 10-foot-wide Line.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage.

Success: Half damage.

Failure or Success: The target starts burning.

Legendary Actions.name: 传奇动作
Legendary Actions.description: The headsman can take 3 legendary actions (4 in Lair), choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. The headsman regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

Move.name: 移动
Move.description: The headsman moves up to half its Speed without provoking Opportunity Attacks.

Rancorous Gaze.name: Rancorous Gaze
Rancorous Gaze.description:
Wisdom Saving Throw: DC 18, one creature the headsman can see within 90 feet.

Failure: The target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

Failure or Success: The headsman can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Relentless Execution.name: Relentless Execution
Relentless Execution.description: The headsman makes one Headsman’s Axe attack with Advantage. If the target has the &reference[Frightened apply=false] condition, treat a 19 on the d20 as a 20. The headsman can’t take this action again until the start of its next turn.

Lair Actions.name: 巢穴动作
Lair Actions.description: The Galloping Headsman’s lair is the stretch of road that serves as the anchor point of the creature’s search for vengeance. If encountered in his lair, the Galloping Headsman has a challenge rating of 19 (22,000 XP). The region containing the Galloping Headsman’s lair is changed by its presence, creating the following effects: If the Galloping Headsman dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.

Encroaching Doom.name: Encroaching Doom
Encroaching Doom.description: Within 6 miles of the lair, an air of doom clings to creatures. Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws made to avoid or end the &Reference[Frightened apply=false] condition that aren’t caused by the Galloping Headsman.

Interminable Journey.name: Interminable Journey
Interminable Journey.description: Paths warp and stretch within 6 miles of the lair. In that area, travel pace outside of combat is halved.

Binding Skull.name: Binding Skull
Binding Skull.description: The headsman has Vulnerability to any damage dealt by a creature holding the headsman’s original skull, and it has Disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls made against that creature.

Legendary Resistance.name: 传奇抗性
Legendary Resistance.description: If the headsman fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

Magic Resistance.name: 魔法抗性
Magic Resistance.description: The headsman has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

cqngSsseMctLr7Y6.description:
Alpengrendel

Brute Born of Mountain Ice

Habitat: Arctic, Mountain

Alpengrendel are hulking creatures covered in bluish white fur, with great tusks and horns. They were born of the ice and darkness of their mountaintop homes, shaped by the unseen hands of a deity of cold stone and gloam. The bitter cold of the mountain peaks infuses both their touch and their breath.

Alpengrendel draw upon the timelessness of the mountains, healing from otherwise lethal wounds in the blink of an eye. They fear only the power of lightning, which can slay them, and the power of the gods, whom they bitterly resent.

Secret. Their disdain for deities runs so deep that alpengrendel are enraged and unnerved by the trappings of faith.

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The alpengrendel makes one [[/item Claws]] attack and one [[/item Tusks]] attack.

Claws.name: 爪击

Tusks.description: Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked &Reference[Prone apply=false].

Frost Breath.name: 冷冻吐息
Frost Breath.description: The alpengrendel breathes out a 30-foot cone of frost. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 21 ([[/r 6d6]]) cold damage, and until the start of the alpengrendel’s next turn, its speed is halved, and it has disadvantage on attack rolls. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage only.

Aversion To Faith.name: Aversion To Faith
Aversion To Faith.description: The alpengrendel has disadvantage on attack rolls while in a consecrated area or on attack rolls against a creature holding or wearing a holy symbol.

Regeneration.name: 再生
Regeneration.description: The alpengrendel regains 10 hit points at the start of each of its turns. If the alpengrendel takes acid or lightning damage, this trait doesn’t function at the start of its next turn. The alpengrendel dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn’t regenerate.

dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq.name: Kackle
dIyqjDIqRxD56Njq.description:
Kackle

Laughing Lantern Bearer

Habitat: Any

Those who were particularly sadistic in life and died consumed by wicked mirth linger as Kackles—ghostly figures that drift above the ground, always flitting just out of sight. Adorned in tattered cloaks and concealing hoods or hats, their hollow laughter echoes through dark places, fading in and out to confuse and terrify their victims. Kackles always carry lanterns lit with ghostly flames, the color of which changes to reflect a kackle’s current cruelty of choice.

Secret. Kackles are bound to their lanterns, and smashing their lights can snuff out the spirits’ existence.

Lantern Flame.name: Lantern Flame
Lantern Flame.description:
Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: [[/attack]] to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 90 ft., one target. Hit: Varies by lantern color (kackle’s choice):

  • Blue. 7 ([[/r 1d6 + 4]]) cold damage, and the target is &Reference[Restrained apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

  • Green. 20 ([[/r 3d10 + 4]]) necrotic damage, and the target’s speed is 0 until the end of its next turn.

  • Purple. 10 ([[/r 1d12 + 4]]) psychic damage, and the target is &Reference[Frightened apply=false] until the end of its next turn.

  • Red. 15 ([[/r 2d10 + 4]]) fire damage, and if the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature within 5 feet of the target takes an action to douse the flames, the target takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

Flickering Teleport.name: Flickering Teleport
Flickering Teleport.description: The kackle teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. The kackle can then change its lantern color, and each creature within 5 feet of the kackle’s destination space must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ([[/r 3d8]]) damage of the same type as the current Lantern Flame color on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Flickering Defense.name: Flickering Defense
Flickering Defense.description: The kackle adds twice its Dexterity modifier to its AC.

Incorporeal Movement.name: 虚体移动
Incorporeal Movement.description: The kackle can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ([[/r 1d10]]) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

Lantern Vulnerability.name: Lantern Vulnerability
Lantern Vulnerability.description: The kackle’s lantern has AC 15 and immunity to poison and psychic damage. Any damage the lantern takes deals half that amount of force damage to the kackle.

dNjGVwXYioTw7396.name: Centipede Hag
dNjGVwXYioTw7396.description:
Centipede Hag

Hag of Pestilence and Flesh-Shaping

Habitat: Hill, Planar (Fey), Urban, Underground

Treasure: Arcana

Centipede hags are grotesque witches that revel in disease and filth, filling their presence with the scuttling vermin they adore. Their magic thrives in the corruption and warping of bodies, and they often engage in horrifying experimentation in grafting, swapping, and combining body parts to create nightmarish new creatures.

Secret. Centipede hags draw more than strength from the filth that covers them; it is the essence of their being. Scrubbing it away dissolves the hag.

Spellcasting.name: 施法
Spellcasting.description:
The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17):

At Will: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplContagion0]{Contagion}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplDisguiseSe]{Disguise Self} (24-hour duration), @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplHoldMonste]{Hold Person}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInvisibili]{Invisibility} (self only)

1/Day Each: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells24.Item.phbsplInsectPlag]{Insect Plague} (level 8 version), Polymorph

Multiattack.name: 多重攻击
Multiattack.description: The hag makes two [[/item Bite]] attacks or uses [[/item Spellcasting]] to cast Contagion. It can also use Warping Caress.

Bite.name: 啃咬
Bite.description: Melee Attack Roll: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target has the &reference[poisoned apply=false] condition until the start of the hag’s next turn.

Warping Caress.name: Warping Caress
Warping Caress.description:
Constitution Saving Throw: DC 17, one creature within 5 feet.

Failure: [[/damage average]] damage, and the target gains 1 &reference[exhaustion apply=false] level. Until the target’s Exhaustion level is reduced to 0, its body is warped and twisted, and it has Disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws that use Strength or Dexterity.

Success: Half damage only.

Failure or Success: If a Humanoid dies from this action, the hag can spend 2 days of work to shape its corpse into a Deepdreck*, or it can combine it with the corpse of a horse to create a Fleshdobbin*.

Coven Magic.name: 集会魔法
Coven Magic.description: While within 30 feet of at least two hag allies, the hag can cast one of the following spells, requiring no Material components, using the spell’s normal casting time, and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability: @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.4v2H3hHb3Ph9XLNd]{Augury}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.JGT5bNqu9REL7Fuz]{Find Familiar}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.3OZnNhunvRtPOQmH]{Identify}, @UUID[Compendium.dnd5e.spells.Item.SleYkHovQ8NagmeV]{Locate Object}, @UUID[Compendium.the-crooked-moon-2024.tcm2024-player-options.Item.cp5KkAHN0XLDh5gc]{Lucky Charm}* (lasts until the hag casts it again, or chooses to end it with no action required), or Unseen Servant. The hag must finish a Long Rest before using this trait to cast that spell again.

Scoured Filth.name: Scoured Filth
Scoured Filth.description: he hag is burned by soapy water. Treat a bucket or flask of it splashed on the hag as a vial of Acid. If the hag is fully immersed in soapy water at the start of its turn, it takes 20 Acid damage.

Spider Climb.name: 蛛行
Spider Climb.description: The hag can climb difficult surfaces, including along ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

Contagion.name: 疫病术contagion
Contagion.description:
你的触碰会散播一种魔法疫病。目标必须进行一次体质豁免，豁免失败则受到11d8暗蚀伤害并获得&Reference[Poisoned apply=false]状态。此外，当你施展该法术时选择一种属性。处于中毒状态时，目标在使用所选属性进行豁免检定时具有劣势。

目标必须在每个自己的回合结束时重复该豁免，直到其累计三次成功或失败。如果目标在此豁免中成功三次，该法术对其结束。如果目标在此豁免中失败三次，该法术将持续7天。

每当中毒目标受到可以结束中毒状态的效果影响时，目标必须进行一次[[/save ability=con dc=@attributes.spell.dc format=long]]，否则其中毒状态不会结束。

Infected (Strength).name: 感染（力量）
Infected (Strength).description:
• 你在陷入 &Reference[Poisoned apply=false] 期间进行被感染属性的豁免检定时具有劣势。

  • 你在你的每回合结束时必须 [[/save ability=con format=long]]{重新}豁免，直至你累计三次成功或失败。

Infected (Intelligence).name: 感染（智力）

Infected (Wisdom).name: 感染（感知）
